006
007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
012
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015
016/**
017   Clip a (projected) {@link Points} that might stick out
018   of the camera's view rectangle in the image plane.
019*/
020public class Clip_Points
021{
022   /**
023      If any {@link Vertex} used by this {@link Points} sticks out
024      of the view rectangle, then delete that vertex's index from
025      the {@link Points}'s vetex and color lists.
026
027      @param model  {@link Model} that the {@link Points} {@code pts} comes from
028      @param pts    {@link Points} to be clipped
029      @return a clipped version of {@code pts} wrapped in an {@link List} object
030   */
031   public static List<Primitive> clip(final Model model,
032                                      final Points pts)
033   {
034      final List<Integer> clippedvIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
035      final List<Integer> clippedcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
036
037      for (int i = 0; i < pts.vIndexList.size(); ++i)
038      {
039         final int vIndex = pts.vIndexList.get(i);
040         final int cIndex = pts.cIndexList.get(i);
041
042         final Vertex v = model.vertexList.get(vIndex);
043         final double x = v.x,  y = v.y;
044
045         // 1. Check for trivial accept.
046         if ( ! ( Math.abs( x ) > 1
047               || Math.abs( y ) > 1) )
048         {
049            clippedvIndexList.add(vIndex);
050            clippedcIndexList.add(cIndex);
051
052            if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial accept: " + vIndex);
053         }
054         // 2. Trivial delete.
055         else
056         {
057            if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial delete: " + vIndex);
058         }
059      }
060
061      if ( clippedvIndexList.isEmpty() )
062      {
063         return new ArrayList<Primitive>();  // better than "return null;"
064      }
065      else
066      {
067         final Points pts2 = new Points(clippedvIndexList,
068                                        clippedcIndexList);
069         pts2.radius = pts.radius;
070         return java.util.Arrays.asList(pts2); // better than "return pts2;"
071      }
072   }
073
074
075
076   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
077   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
078   private Clip_Points() {
079      throw new AssertionError();
080   }
081}
